body_html:
Have you tried to install nv_peer_mem driver to enable GDR?

By the way, what is the output for command ulimit -l? If you have inherit limit for page-locked memory, the RDMA memory allocator might not be able to register enough memory region. It is thus recommended to modify the limits in /etc/security/limits.conf.
body_text:
Have you tried to install nv_peer_mem driver to enable GDR?
By the way, what is the output for command ulimit -l? If you have inherit limit for page-locked memory, the RDMA memory allocator might not be able to register enough memory region. It is thus recommended to modify the limits in /etc/security/limits.conf.
body:
Have you tried to install `nv_peer_mem` driver to enable GDR?

By the way, what is the output for command `ulimit -l`? If you have inherit limit for page-locked memory, the RDMA memory allocator might not be able to register enough memory region. It is thus recommended to modify the limits in `/etc/security/limits.conf`.
